ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Newbie Bard needs hunting suggestions
ygData.msgSnippet: Okay, I have a few minutes to do this ;o)~ 10-19 The Karanas.  More importantly, North Karana fighting wolves and bears, then moving to EK and camping Reaver
ygData.messageBody:
Okay, I have a few minutes to do this ;o)~

10-19 The Karanas. More importantly, North Karana fighting wolves and
bears, then moving to EK and camping Reaver Hill.

19-22 Lake Rathe. Hunting aviaks was great experience. Favorite spot?
The Cove.

22-28 South Karana. The Hermit and I go waaaaaaaaaaaay back. Not only is
he great exp, but he can drop up to 2p 6g, and FS weapons from time to time,
*but* he is a 4 & 1/2 minutes spawn (approx.). If he was still giving me
exp, I'ld probably still be camping him ;o)~

28-32 Lake of Ill Omen. (Thank GOD for RoK!) Hang out at the gobbie caves
for the first 2 levels (no one is ever camping the back entrance), then move
over to the Sarnak fortress. There is a little plataeu not far from where
the path runs out that is *perfect* for pulling to.

33-35 Lots of places. One of the best places I've found is getting into a
giant group at the FV giant camps. This gives good exp to me still at 35,
and they are just now starting to cone white.

-=B=-
less than a bubble away from leaving Hell 2
----- Original Message -----
From: Bill Costlow <atlatyl@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, July 05, 2000 10:19 AM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Newbie Bard needs hunting suggestions


> My experience:
>
> 10-15 West Commons and S Ro hunting Dervs. There is a
> guy in S. Ro you can turn rings in to for some xp and
> faction with the Temple of Solusek Ro.
>
> 15-20 Lake Rathetear or hunt orcs in the Rathe Mtns.
> There is an orc village near the Paladin Camp in the
> Rathe Mtns that is seldom camped. I recommend a
> partner for this. you can run to the Pally camp if
> you get into trouble
>
> 20-30 Lake of Ill Omen. Start near the ruins on the
> South side of the lake, then look at the gob mines in
> the NW corner, then the Sarnak Castle in the NE
> corner. (cool stuff drops in the castle)
>
>
> Tyunes of Rodcet Nife
> stuck in the first lvl of hell
>
>
> --- "Webber, Jessica" <webber@...> wrote:
> > The bard formerly known as Tszaaz wrote:
> >
> > > 10-12 Blackburrow
> > > (I know it inside out and it is a great dungeon
> > for bards)
> > >
> > > 12-15 Kurns Tower
> > > (which means dropping lots of silver, but all
> > those warriors
> > > are going to
> > > love being hasted)
> > >
> > > 15-20 Unrest
> > > (I never hunted there before as my previous
> > computer couldn't
> > > handle it)
> > >
> > > 20-25 Lake of Ill Omen
> > > (I took Tszaaz from 25-30 there, it might get
> > tedious, might not)
> > >
> > > I am not feeling particularly inspired by this
> > list however.
> > > If anyone has
> > > suggestions for when, as a bard, to go where I
> > would
> > > appreciate it.
> >
> > I'm entirely unqualified to give you advice, but I
> > would like to know why
> > you feel Blackburrow is such a good dungeon for
> > bards. I've found it to be
> > lag-city (2 song max) and have not been able to
> > successfully hunt there with
> > either my bard, shaman, wizard, or rogue. I
> > understand it's a good spot for
> > a necro though. But then, what isn't?
> >
> > Peace
> > Evulia, bard of 11 missed notes, Ro/Commons/Thicket,
> > Tunare
> >
> >
> >
>
>
